data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Particle3D(pu):if use this blendFuc(scene_blend alpha_blend) it will get a Black border.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.14
- devices test on:ios simualator
- developing environments ios
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. produc a pu effect (use alpha_blend blendfunc) and put it in a scence(not black scence).
2. run it then you will find a Black border surround your material texture(may white texture will find easier ).

data.title: runAction is not executed under setonEnterTransitionDidFinishCallback when returning a TransitionFade* on HelloWorld::createScene()
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.14
- devices test on: LG G3 Stylus (Android), Lenovo x220T (Linux)
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13
   - GCC version: 6.3.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new C++ project and replace  `Classes/HelloWorldScene.cpp` template with the attached code: [HelloWorldScene.cpp.txt](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/811773/HelloWorldScene.cpp.txt)
2. After setting the `setonEnterTransitionDidFinishCallback` callback on HelloWorld::create(), the runAction method will not be executed for the created scene under the previously mentioned callback after Director::getRunningScene gets called if we return a TransitionFade* object created from that scene. (See the code and messages).

**Workaround**
I'm not quite sure if the above is considered a bug, but creating a TransitionFade object first and then setting the callbacks and node tags works well.

data.title: cocos compile run -p android no longer works after Android SDK update
data.body:
Just updated Android SDK tools to the latest version 25.3.1 and now tools/android.bat no longer works, it reports:
```
The "android" command is no longer available.
For manual SDK and AVD management, please use Android Studio.
For command-line tools, use
tools\bin\sdkmanager.bat and tools\bin\avdmanager.bat
Error running command, return code: 1.
```

- cocos2d-x version: 3.14

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Update android SDK to the latest versions
2. Launch android app build `compile compile -p android` or ``compile run -p android``

data.title: The log should be reorder
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open some demo of cocos2d-x 3.14
2. Check the log of console.

```
{
	gl.supports_OES_map_buffer: false
	gl.supports_vertex_array_object: true
	cocos2d.x.version: cocos2d-x-3.14
	gl.vendor: NVIDIA Corporation
	gl.supports_PVRTC: false
	gl.renderer: NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M OpenGL Engine
	cocos2d.x.compiled_with_profiler: false
	cocos2d.x.build_type: DEBUG
	cocos2d.x.compiled_with_gl_state_cache: true
	gl.max_texture_size: 16384
	gl.supports_ETC1: false
	gl.supports_BGRA8888: false
	gl.max_texture_units: 16
	gl.supports_OES_packed_depth_stencil: false
	gl.supports_ATITC: false
	gl.supports_discard_framebuffer: false
	gl.supports_NPOT: true
	gl.version: 2.1 NVIDIA-10.14.20 355.10.05.15f03
	gl.supports_S3TC: true
	gl.supports_OES_depth24: false
}
```
The log is too hard to read, I think it should be reordered

data.title: Does win10 platform support Lua and JS?
data.body:
A developer reported that he didn't know how to create a win10 project with Lua support.

Currently, I only find `proj.win10` folder in `cpp` tests and `cpp` template.
It seems it is missing in `lua` & `js` testcase and template projects.

@stammen , could you please take some time to answer this question?

data.title: macOS FileUtils::getWritablePath() uses Ducuments directory
data.body:
When you call `cocos2d::FileUtils::getInstance()->getWritablePath()` on macOS it returns `NSDocumentDirectory` [code link](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/platform/apple/CCFileUtils-apple.mm#L239). I think its not good idea use User's Documents directory to store game data and files. I, as a mac user, do not want to fill my Documents folder with service data.
On windows cocos uses AppData dirrectory, on macOS analog of this directory is Application Support folder. Maybe you should change code for macOS target like this:
`[NSArray *paths = NSSearchPathForDirectoriesInDomains(NSApplicationSupportDirectory, NSUserDomainMask, YES);`
also i think it's good idea append game name to end of path, to create folder with game name.

data.title: [Android] AudioEngine::play2d may still wait 2 seconds if preload is too fast.
data.body:
Reported by @Dauch .
Please refer to https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/17233

- cocos2d-x version: v3.14.1
- devices test on: YeShen(夜神) Emulator (X86)
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e
   - Xcode version: N/A
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Extract [17.mp3.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/802750/17.mp3.zip) to 17.mp3.
2. AudioEngine::play2d("17.mp3");
3. Run it on YeShen emulator.

data.title: Lua project set a ccui.Text String crash on Android
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14+
- devices test on: android windows
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

```
local pText = ccui.Text:create()
pText:setString("")
pText:addTo(self)
DelayCall.delay(function()
    pText:removeFromParent()
    DelayCall.delay(function()
        pText:setString("")
    end, 1)
end, 1)
```

On windows it will prop a error(not crash):
>invalid 'cobj' in function 'lua_cocos2dx_ui_Text_setString'


But on android it will crash, I think best way to is prop a error rather then crash.
